items.title: Live update: Wall Street closes in on fresh record ahead of expected Fed rate cut, ASX poised to slip

items.summary: The offer is made at a summit in New Delhi, where new deals on energy, agriculture and labour have also been announced.

items.title: Australia delights in a familiar Ashes tale of English woe to take control at the Gabba
items.summary: Australia took control of the second Ashes Test at the Gabba on a day that carried plenty of the hallmarks of failed English tours of yesteryear.

items.title: Senator who backs social media ban says she was a victim of a catfishing attempt in high school
items.summary: As the social media ban for teens looms, the parliament's most recent senator reveals she knows firsthand the dangers that can confront young people online.

items.title: Lebanon says it's trying to disarm Hezbollah but fears sparking internal conflict
items.summary: Lebanon's government says it is trying to disarm militant group Hezbollah, but there are fears of sparking an internal conflict.

items.title: Today in History, December 6: The day scientists found evidence of water on Mars
items.summary: Scientists said at the time that the flow of water would have filled multiple swimming pools.

items.title: Porridge back on the menu as budget pressures grow
items.summary: How does a treasurer tell households the government will no longer continue a $300 energy rebate when it's happy to blow $100,000 on three flights?

items.title: Russian manpower challenges Ukraine's technological edge
items.summary: When it comes to weaponry, Russia has strength in manpower despite Ukraine's early technological edge while Europe's arms production efforts are running into infrastructure hurdles.

items.title: Netflix wins deal to buy Warner Bros's film and TV studio and streaming service for $108bn
items.summary: The merger will see beloved shows and movies such as The Big Bang Theory, Game of Thrones and The Wizard of Oz join Netflix’s portfolio.

items.title: WA Police charge children over Geraldton bushfire that destroyed home
items.summary: WA Police allege young boys were responsible for lighting a fire in Geraldton last weekend that later reignited and destroyed a home in an outer suburb of the Mid West city.

items.title: Jacob Elordi, Nicole Kidman, Alison Brie among the 2026 AACTA nominees
items.summary: Apple Cider Vinegar, a partly fictionalised retelling of accused wellness scammer Belle Gibson's public fall from grace, leads this year's AACTA nominations.

items.title: NZ police recover stolen James Bond-inspired Fabergé pendant after suspect swallowed it
items.summary: Police officers were with the suspect around the clock until the stolen pendant was recovered.

items.title: Cary-Hiroyuki Tagawa, actor who performed in Mortal Kombat, has died at 75
items.summary: Tagawa died surrounded by his family in Santa Barbara from complications due to a stroke, according to his manager Margie Weiner.

items.title: Tasmania Devils could play extra year in existing venues during Macquarie Point stadium construction
items.summary: The Tasmania Devils CEO says the club will likely play in the AFL from existing venues for a year longer than expected, while awaiting construction of the Macquarie Point stadium.

items.title: Friday Finance with David Chau
items.summary: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

items.title: Driver in fatal Daylesford pub crash will face court in bid to avoid giving evidence
items.summary: A diabetic man previously charged over a crash that killed five wants to object to giving evidence, on the grounds it may be self-incriminating.

items.title: NSW tourist who hit woman on mobility scooter in WA's south avoids jail
items.summary: Paul Vallely has received a fine and had his driver's licence suspended for hitting a woman on a mobility scooter in Albany in September.

items.title: Elderly Perth accountant Joseph Papalia jailed for stealing millions from friends, family
items.summary: An elderly Perth accountant who stole nearly $10 million from family, friends and former clients is jailed for more than 11 years.

items.title: Chevron invests $3b to continue development of the Gorgon gas project
items.summary: The works will connect gas fields in the Greater Gorgon Area to existing infrastructure on Barrow Island.

items.title: Unlicensed driver hears impact of single-vehicle crash that killed three friends near Tarago
items.summary: Nowra man Lachlan Stuckey is facing three charges of dangerous driving occasioning death over a single-vehicle car crash which killed three of his friends near Tarago in July last year.

items.title: Man accused of killing passenger in car rollover found not guilty of causing death
items.summary: A driver accused of killing a passenger in a car rollover captured by his own dash cam has been found not guilty of causing the death, but guilty of aggravated driving without due care.

items.title: Jury deliberations begin in trial of Rajwinder Singh, accused of murdering Toyah Cordingley in 2018
items.summary: The jury will retire to deliberate on the case of Rajwinder Singh, who is charged with the 2018 murder of Toyah Cordingley, after an almost four-week trial in the Supreme Court in Cairns.

items.title: High Court to hear appeal against reduced sentence for teenager who killed Emma Lovell
items.summary: Emma Lovell was murdered at her North Lakes home on Boxing Day in 2022 by the then 17-year-old, who was sentenced to 14 years in prison in 2024.

items.title: Families of officers killed in Wieambilla attack launch court action against Queensland and NSW police
items.summary: The families of the two officers murdered at Wieambilla in 2022 have made personal injury claims against Queensland and New South Wales police.

items.title: Israel's continued participation in Eurovision the latest in a string of contentious moments
items.summary: Eurovision strives to put pop before politics, but it has repeatedly become embroiled in world events, particularly relating to Israel.

items.title: Six native trees poisoned along Noosa's Sunshine Beach
items.summary: Six Australian native trees have been poisoned on public land along one of Queensland's most expensive and exclusive beachside streets.

items.title: Barwon Coast closes Breamlea track near Geelong after identifying asbestos-containing fragments
items.summary: Asbestos has been discovered scattered throughout parts of a coastal town near the Great Ocean Road, prompting land managers to close a section to the public.

items.title: Former Western Sydney University student charged over more cyber attacks while on bail
items.summary: A former Western Sydney University student already charged with hacking into the institution's servers allegedly continued a campaign against the university by sending more than 109,000 fraudulent emails to students.

items.title: Ashes 2025 updates: Australia leads wasteful England by 44 runs on day two at the Gabba
items.summary: Will Jacks took a sensational catch, but England dropped five other chances as Australia builds a first innings lead on day two of the second Test Ashes Test at the Gabba.

items.title: Police search for gunman after shooting at Ballajura candy shop in suburban Perth
items.summary: A search is underway for a gunman who fired shots at a store in Perth's north in what police believe was a stand-over tactic by organised crime networks involved in the sale of illegal tobacco.

items.title: Will a controversial water plan lead to 'bad years' for Roper River barramundi?
items.summary: Documents obtained under Freedom of Information laws have revealed planned water extraction from the aquifer that feeds the Northern Territory's Roper River could lead to "bad years" for its fish populations.

items.title: Bo Popowski receives upgraded charge of murder over death of four-year-old in north-west Tasmania
items.summary: Bo Popowski's defence lawyer told the courtroom this was the first time he had heard the word murder used for the case and that he would need time to speak to his client.

items.title: Ayers Rock Resort to be sold to American-owned tourism company
items.summary: A deal for the sale of operations at Ayers Rock Resort, near Uluru, and the Mossman Gorge Cultural Centre, in Far North Queensland, is one step closer after the Indigenous Land and Sea Corporation reached an agreement with Journey Beyond, an Australian-based "experiential tourism" company owned by an American private equity firm.

items.title: Man from high-profile Victorian family found guilty of rape
items.summary: A County Court jury finds a man guilty of two charges of raping a woman in his home after a night of drinking with friends.

items.title: Family lose holiday home on Tasmania's east coast
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: SA Liberal leader Vincent Tarzia steps down from leadership
items.summary: South Australian Liberal leader Vincent Tarzia will step down from the leadership, just three months out from the next state election. He told a press conference he made the decision on Friday morning.

items.title: WA miners build up massive gold stockpiles at Perth Mint amid record prices
items.summary: WA gold miners are stockpiling millions of dollars worth of the precious metal, believing it is more valuable than cash in the current environment.

items.title: Fires, heatwaves strike across Australia with emergency warnings issued — as it happened
items.summary: A broad heatwave is expected to spread across Australia, with short and sharp bursts of heat throughout the southern states.

items.title: US military says it killed four men in strike on suspected drug vessel
items.summary: The US military says it has killed four men in a strike on a suspected drug vessel in international waters in the Eastern Pacific

items.title: Socceroo Aziz Behich excited that World Cup draw could set up rematch with Argentina
items.summary: The Socceroos cannot wait to learn who their opponents will be at the upcoming World Cup, especially if it allows them to handle some unfinished business.

items.title: Australian red-tipped bananas go viral as social media interest ramps up
items.summary: Red-tipped bananas are not new to Australian consumers, but they have gone viral on social media this month after an inquisitive post from two bewildered British backpackers.

items.title: Country Hour reporters join listeners to celebrate 80 years of broadcasting
items.summary: Outside broadcasts highlight how the Country Hour connects with the daily life of rural Australia.

items.title: Dozens of property damaged in Dolphin Sands bushfire on Tasmania's east coast
items.summary: There has been damage to at least 19 homes and shacks and 15 outbuildings at Dolphin Sands, on Tasmania's east coast, firefighters say, with residents told it is not yet safe to return.

items.title: Housing crisis taking a toll on caravan park owners in WA's South West
items.summary: The housing crisis is landing at the doorstep of caravan parks and owners like Greg Homer, who says the transition from tourism operator to landlord is taking a toll.

items.title: Diners and commercial fishers to feel impact of WA demersal fishing ban
items.summary: New fishing rules come into effect in Western Australia next month, significantly reducing the amount of local fish available in the state.

items.title: Pentagon's AUKUS review finds areas to put nuclear submarine pact on 'strongest possible footing'
items.summary: The review has "identified opportunities to put AUKUS on the strongest possible footing", the Pentagon says. But a congressman who has seen the report says it "fully endorses" the pact.

items.title: Compressed air energy storage is coming to Broken Hill, but how does it work?
items.summary: Broken Hill will be the location of Australia's first large-scale compressed air energy storage system. What is it and how does it work?

items.title: Local consortium races to rescue Sanjeev Gupta's Tahmoor mine
items.summary: A local consortium is rushing to put forward a bid for the mothballed Tahmoor coal mine, saying it wants the site reopened quickly to protect hundreds of jobs.

items.title: ChatGPT's owner OpenAI launches in Australia, partners with NextDC, ASX closes slightly higher — as it happened
items.summary: The company that brought AI into household vernacular launched in Australia today. It comes as other companies like Meta are struggling to make traction in this space.

items.title: South Australian golf course wetland is breeding site for locally extinct tiny native olive perchlet
items.summary: Golf courses around the world feature picturesque water ponds as a challenging hazard for players to avoid, but scientists are diving right in. They say golf club wetlands are an ecological safe haven to repopulate threatened native fish.

items.title: Rheumatic heart disease cases drastically reduced in North West Queensland
items.summary: A lack of access to clean clothes and sheets led to high rates of heart disease in this outback Queensland town. But an Indigenous-led washing initiative is changing health outcomes in the region.

items.title: The cold supermoon will appear in the night sky tonight. Here's how to spot it
items.summary: The final supermoon of the year is set to delight stargazers tonight. Here's how to spot it.

items.title: A blend of Cool Runnings, Eddie the Eagle: The Filipino curling team on the cusp of an Olympic spot
items.summary: The idea of the Philippines curling team reaching the Winter Olympics has a hint of Cool Runnings about it, while one team member, Alan Frei, has more than a suggestion of Eddie the Eagle. But at the heart of this story is a genuine sporting fairytale that is one step away from becoming an Olympic legend.

items.title: Impacts of working from home on mental health tracked in study of 16,000 Australians
items.summary: Working from home can positively impact the mental health of Australian men and women in different ways, according to a new study of more than 16,000 people.

items.title: Living with ADHD and how I make my life easier after being diagnosed as an adult
items.summary: International Day of People with Disability scholar Mark du Potiers shares how attention deficit hyperactivity disorder impacts him day-to-day and what he does to make life more manageable.

items.title: Heatwave stretches from Kimberley to Sydney as hot summer arrives
items.summary: The burst of heat is short and sharp in southern states, sending temperatures more than 10 degrees Celsius above average and raising fire dangers to extreme, with the heat to linger into next week in the northern outback.

items.title: Pentagon watchdog releases report on Pete Hegseth's use of Signal app
items.summary: The 84-page report finds US Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth violated policy and could have put American troops at risk when he used the Signal app to discuss military strikes in Yemen.

items.title: Lawyers to face regulators after AI was used to prepare legal document
items.summary: Three lawyers will face Australian legal regulators, with one ordered to pay $10,000 in costs, after submitting a legal document prepared with artificial intelligence and found to contain "inaccurate and misleading references".

items.title: Israel-aligned anti-Hamas Gaza militia leader Yasser Abu Shabab killed
items.summary: Gaza militia leader Yasser Abu Shabab, whose anti-Hamas group had been supported by Israel, has been killed after an attack in southern Gaza.

items.title: Australia's PALM workers are leaving their employers, becoming 'extremely vulnerable' in visa limbo
items.summary: Pacific Islanders have been leaving Australia's guest worker scheme, a decision that breaches their visa conditions and leaves them "extremely vulnerable".

items.title: Industrial relations are risky business for the Liberals after WorkChoices
items.summary: The Liberals argue Labor's industrial relations concessions to the unions are a "handbrake on productivity" but this area has been tricky for the Coalition since John Howard's disastrous overreach.

items.title: Teen becomes first nationally accredited netball umpire in a wheelchair
items.summary: Brodie Taylor has changed the game of netball by overturning disability preconceptions to become the first person in a wheelchair to attain national netball umpiring accreditation.

items.title: Search engines will soon have to blur porn image results in Australia
items.summary: Pornographic image results will be blurred and searches for self-harm information will redirect to mental health supports under new Australian online safety codes.

items.title: Is Tasmanian AFL team a holy grail or poisoned chalice? Time will tell
items.summary: When it comes to the Macquarie Point stadium in Tasmania, there is clearly something deeper at play than seats, concrete and a roof. You simply couldn't vote for it otherwise, writes Chris Rowbottom.

items.title: Corowa residents caught off guard by 'early' fire a sign of 'apathy', authorities say
items.summary: A fast moving grass fire almost burned through the southern NSW town of Corowa last week. Despite the extreme fire danger rating, residents say they weren't prepared for such an intense fire so early in the season.

items.title: The best new TV shows of 2025, from The Golden Bachelor to The Studio
items.summary: From a send-up of Hollywood studios to a chilling depiction of violence and masculinity to an age-appropriate reality TV romance, these are our favourite TV shows of 2025.

items.title: Weekly news quiz: Blacked-out raccoon, poor strategy call and the PM's wedding
items.summary: Think you have had your ears to the ground? It's time to test your knowledge of the week that was.

items.title: AUKUS will survive Trump, says Australia's top diplomat in London Stephen Smith
items.summary: The trilateral agreement has come under significant scrutiny, but Australia's top diplomat in London says he believes its future is assured.

items.title: Israel to compete at Eurovision Song Contest in 2026, prompting several nations to withdraw
items.summary: Public broadcasters in Spain, Ireland and the Netherlands say they will not participate in next year's event and more are expected to follow.

items.title: New York Times sues the Pentagon over press access restrictions
items.summary: The US publication has filed a lawsuit over a new policy requiring journalists to sign a pledge to refrain from reporting information not authorised for release by the Pentagon.
